brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion (ADME) of single dose
      [14C] selumetinib in volunteers

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism and Excretion (ADME) of Single Dose [14C] Selumetinib in Volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Provision of signed and dated, written informed consent prior to any study specific
             procedures.

          -  Have a body mass index (BMI) between 18 and 32 kg/m2 inclusive and weigh at least 50
             kg and no more than 100 kg, inclusive.

          -  Regular bowel movements (ie, on average production of at least 1 stool per day).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Current or past history of central serous retinopathy or retinal vein thrombosis,
             intraocular pressure greater than 21 mmHg or uncontrolled glaucoma.

          -  Exposure to radiation levels above background  exceeding 5 mSv in the last 12 months
             or 10 mSv in the last 5 years.

          -  History or presence of any clinically significant disease or disorder in the opinion
             of the investigator

          -  Any clinically important abnormalities in clinical chemistry, haematology, or
             urinalysis results, vital signs or ECG at baseline in the opinion of the
             Investigator.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Single-centre, Non-randomised, Open-label, Pharmacokinetic and Mass Balance Study of Orally Administered [14C]-Selumetinib in Healthy Male Volunteers

oversight_info.authority: United Kingdom: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of total radioactivity in blood and plasma and percentage of radioactive dose in urine and faeces and total balance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolite profiling and identification in plasma and excreta
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days.

secondary_outcome.description: Cmax, tmax, t½, AUC, CL/F, Vz/F, MRT, fe, Ae, CLR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days.
Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events, vital signs, electrocardiogram, haematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis, physical examination, left ventricular ejection fraction, and opthalmology assessments.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments prior to treatment and after treatment including follow up.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
